title: 86/116/EEC: Commission Decision of 7 March 1986 concerning the zones referred to in Article 2 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 2616/80 instituting a specific Community regional development measure contributing to overcoming constraints on the development of new economic activities in certain zones adversely affected by restructuring of the steel industry (Only the English text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 7 March 1986
concerning the zones referred to in Article 2 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 2616/80 instituting a specific Community regional development measure contributing to overcoming constraints on the development of new economic activities in certain zones adversely affected by restructuring of the steel industry
(Only the English text is authentic)
(86/116/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The zones referred to in Article 2 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 2616/80 are, in the case of the United Kingdom, as follows: the counties of Cleveland, Clwyd, Gwent, Humberside (together with that part of the travel-to-work area of Scunthorpe situated in the county of Lincolnshire), South Yorkshire (including the travel-to-work area of Sheffield) and the region of Strathclyde.
2. The references to travel-to-work areas in point 1 are to those areas as constituted on 18 January 1984.
This Decision is addressed to the United Kingdom.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 7 March 1986.
For the Commission
Alois PFEIFFER
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 271, 15. 10. 1980, p. 9.
(2) OJ No L 27, 31. 1. 1984, p. 9.
